Description: Ostracon, large section of the upper body of a red-grey pottery jar with flaring sides, becoming convex at shoulder, and one handle surviving, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is spotted with light-brown granular deposit, the exterior is covered with a reddish slip and remains of one line of black-painted hieratic text identifying the contents as honey of the Aten for his fore.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393531) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393531)
